abstract: The coincidence of my meeting Selby Adams and re-uniting him with my mother is one I will never forget
description: When Joan showed a photo of her new boyfriend to her mother, her mother remarked that he looked a lot like Selby Adams, a british pen friend she wrote to in World War I. Joan served in the Austrlalian Women's Army Service during World War II and, as a result of that service, was able to re-unite her mother with her pen friend from Britain. An amazing coincidence
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2001753; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [June 2009]; Active; 2009
